intro: Bromus submuticus, commonly known as the soft brome, is a perennial grass native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that are often丛生 (tufted) at the base.
